Description: Irregular textile fragment of undyed(?) linen cloth of medium quality; short looped warp fringe across one end with the weft spreading out towards the end of the loops; other edges ragged. The weave is plain [warp faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.29 ends per 10mm and weft 17 picks per 10mm. Some insect damage.
Curator's comments: The type of looped warp fringe is typical of Middle Kingdom cloths and indicated, according to De Jonghe, the use of the ground loom with tubular warp. See also comments on EA 6506. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
